ModMetaData.name: Realistic Darkness V2.0 A16
ModMetaData.author: Helpful Bot; Inspired by Viceroy, creator of Darkness Revamp which was updated by Cram and to A14 by Helpful Bot
ModMetaData.description: This mod changes lighting and saturation in rimworld to be dynamically darker. This mod overrides your vanilla weather definitions (Could not be avoided, this was not elective) Includes: -Daylight remains unchanged but weather patterns have a stronger effect on light levels even during daylight hours. -Nights are considerably darker. -Night darkness changes dynamically with weather conditions: +Hard/Gentle snow are the lightest nights +Dry thunderstorms are only slightly darker than clear nights. +Foggy Rain is the darkest. YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO SEE AREAS UNLIT BY TORCHES/LIGHTS DURING THIS WEATHER PATTERN. -Saturation (color strength) changes more dynamically in response to weather. -Movespeed and ranged accuracy are very close to vanilla values. Hard snow and foggy rain are harshest on accuracy and movement (foggy rain movement is same as rain). -Eclipses are now as dark as clear nights.
